faq.question: What is the corporate tax rate in Bangladesh?
faq.answer: Corporate tax rates in Bangladesh vary based on the type of companyâ€”ranging from 22.5% for listed companies to 27.5% for non-listed companies. Rates may differ for banks, insurance, and mobile operators.

faq.question: When is the corporate tax filing deadline?
faq.answer: Generally, the filing deadline is the 15th day of the 7th month following the income year. We ensure your return is prepared and submitted well before the deadline.

faq.question: Do SMEs need to file corporate tax returns?
faq.answer: Yes. All registered companies and SMEs with a TIN are required to file annual corporate tax returns with NBR.

faq.question: Can you handle audit coordination with NBR?
faq.answer: Yes. We coordinate with auditors and NBR officials on your behalf, ensuring proper documentation and representation during any audit proceedings.

faq.question: What documents are needed for corporate tax filing?
faq.answer: Key documents include audited financial statements, bank statements, TDS certificates, advance tax challans, trade license, and TIN certificate. We provide a detailed checklist during onboarding.
